item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

Replace your Compile with this

@ECHO Checking for errors @ECHO ----------------------- @ECHO off COLOR 70 title Checking for Errors @ECHO Checking for errors... one moment. javac *.java pause

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

moniz123:

yea lol wat r code tags?

[quote] [/quote]

These are quote tags.

[code]
[/code]

Code tags.

Many more tags beond this, etc…[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 10:06:00 PM[/size][hr][quote=“moniz123, post:25, topic:32132”]wow… i thought this was only happenning to me[/quote][quote=“killer5kumi, post:27, topic:32132”]waT?[/quote]

Your errors are simple. Goto into any folder and go up to the tools tab at the top. Then click “Folder Options”. Once a new window comes up, click the “view” tab on that window. Scroll down until you see a checkbox that says “Hide file extensions for known file types” and UNCHECK THAT. Then click ok, ok, then you will now see extensions (.java, .class, .bat, .txt, etc…) Now, right click in your main folder, goto the sort by option and it will bring a slide menu, now click the “type”. Now this will organize all of your icons. Now DELETE ALL OF THE CLASS AND ONLY CLASS FILES. This organizes it even more. Now make a new folder for your Java files called “src”. PUT ALL OF YOUR JAVA FILES INSIDE THE “src” FOLDER. Now delete your old compiler. Open up notepad and put in the following code:

@echo off
color 02
title Run&Compiler
"C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_10injavac.exe" -cp . .src*.java
pause
move .src*.class .classes
cls
pause
if exist .classes
un.bat (goto step1) else (goto step2)
:step1
cd .classes
call .
un.bat
:step2
echo @echo off >> .classes
un.bat
echo title Run&Compiler >> .classes
un.bat
echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server  >> .classes
un.bat
echo pause >> .classes
un.bat
cd .classes
call .
un.bat

Now save this as “RunAll.bat” inside of your main source folder. Run this and it will compile all of your Java files in the src folder and move the new class files into a folder called classes which it makes if it does not already exist. This will almost fully organize your source.

NOTE DO NOT FORGET TO MOVE THE DATA FOLDER, CACHE FOLDER, CFG FILES AND/OR CFG FOLDER, WEATHER.TXT, AND LOGS FOLDER INTO THE CLASSES FOLDER, IF THIS IS NOT DONE, YOUR SERVER WILL HAVE A BUTLOAD OF PAINFUL ERRORS TO FIX.

Ok this is the final pictures of what your source should look like:

[img][quote=“moniz123, post:25, topic:32132”]wow… i thought this was only happenning to me[/quote][quote=“killer5kumi, post:27, topic:32132”]waT?[/quote]

Your errors are simple. Goto into any folder and go up to the tools tab at the top. Then click “Folder Options”. Once a new window comes up, click the “view” tab on that window. Scroll down until you see a checkbox that says “Hide file extensions for known file types” and UNCHECK THAT. Then click ok, ok, then you will now see extensions (.java, .class, .bat, .txt, etc…) Now, right click in your main folder, goto the sort by option and it will bring a slide menu, now click the “type”. Now this will organize all of your icons. Now DELETE ALL OF THE CLASS AND ONLY CLASS FILES. This organizes it even more. Now make a new folder for your Java files called “src”. PUT ALL OF YOUR JAVA FILES INSIDE THE “src” FOLDER. Now delete your old compiler. Open up notepad and put in the following code:

@echo off
color 02
title Run&Compiler
"C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_10injavac.exe" -cp . .src*.java
pause
move .src*.class .classes
cls
pause
if exist .classes
un.bat (goto step1) else (goto step2)
:step1
cd .classes
call .
un.bat
:step2
echo @echo off >> .classes
un.bat
echo title Run&Compiler >> .classes
un.bat
echo java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server  >> .classes
un.bat
echo pause >> .classes
un.bat
cd .classes
call .
un.bat

Now save this as “RunAll.bat” inside of your main source folder. Run this and it will compile all of your Java files in the src folder and move the new class files into a folder called classes which it makes if it does not already exist. This will almost fully organize your source.

NOTE DO NOT FORGET TO MOVE THE DATA FOLDER, CACHE FOLDER, CFG FILES AND/OR CFG FOLDER, WEATHER.TXT, AND LOGS FOLDER INTO THE CLASSES FOLDER, IF THIS IS NOT DONE, YOUR SERVER WILL HAVE A BUTLOAD OF PAINFUL ERRORS TO FIX.

Ok this is the final pictures of what your source should look like:

} Do not worry about the X, it was necessary to get the 2 pictures working. You are not missing any picures.

item.dc:creator: @slowdown slowdown
item.description:
@slowdown wrote:

[quote=“killer5kumi, post:1, topic:32132”]Problem:Wen I Click My compile.bat For TestScape it says Note: stream.java uses or overrides a depricated API. Then It Says Below That :Note Recompile With -Xlint :deprication for details.And Below That It Says Exeption in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server, Then Below That It Says Press any key to continue . . .! What Is Wrong With It ,Its Testscape So If U Can Help Me Help Me… Plus I Right Clicked compile.bat And I Clicked Edit, I Made It Look Like This After I Edited It

@echo off
title kylezscape
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\java.exe” server
pause

Is This Write, If It Isnt Post What SHOULD Be There, Or Whats Wrong With It, Thank You If You Can Help Me. Ty Also If You Tryed To Help Me.[/quote]
USE CODE TAGS!!!

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Ok, you have to go to the folder that the folder your files are in is in, but don’t move those files.

Put in your compiler

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class ./Java/*.java
"C:\Program Files\Java\Jdk1.5.0_10\bin\java.exe" -cp Class; server

item.source: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“killer5kumi, post:12, topic:32132”]i know, but is i found it (I THINK) its a notepad thing and it says server wen i open it it looks like this… IS THAT RIGHT?

import java.sql.;
import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class server implements Runnable {

public server() {
	// the current way of controlling the server at runtime and a great debugging/testing tool
	//jserv js = new jserv(this);
	//js.start();

}

// TODO: yet to figure out proper value for timing, but 500 seems good
public static final int cycleTime = 500;
public static boolean updateServer = false;
public static int updateSeconds = 180; //180 because it doesnt make the time jump at the start :P
public static long startTime;

public static void main(java.lang.String args[]) {
	clientHandler = new server();
	(new Thread(clientHandler)).start();			// launch server listener
	playerHandler = new PlayerHandler();
	npcHandler = new NPCHandler();
	itemHandler = new ItemHandler();
	shopHandler = new ShopHandler();
            antilag = new antilag();
            itemspawnpoints = new itemspawnpoints();
             GraphicsHandler = new GraphicsHandler();
	int waitFails = 0;
	long lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
	long totalTimeSpentProcessing = 0;
	int cycle = 0;
	while(!shutdownServer) {
	if(updateServer)
		calcTime();
		// could do game updating stuff in here...
		// maybe do all the major stuff here in a big loop and just do the packet
		// sending/receiving in the client subthreads. The actual packet forming code
		// will reside within here and all created packets are then relayed by the subthreads.
		// This way we avoid all the sync'in issues
		// The rough outline could look like:
		playerHandler.process();			// updates all player related stuff
		npcHandler.process();
		itemHandler.process();
		shopHandler.process();
                    antilag.process();
                    itemspawnpoints.process();
                    System.gc();
		// doNpcs()		// all npc related stuff
		// doObjects()
		// doWhatever()

		// taking into account the time spend in the processing code for more accurate timing
		long timeSpent = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastTicks;
		totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent;
		if(timeSpent >= cycleTime) {
			timeSpent = cycleTime;
			if(++waitFails > 500) {
				shutdownServer = true;
				misc.println("[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!");
			}
		}
		try {
			Thread.sleep(cycleTime-timeSpent);
		} catch(java.lang.Exception _ex) { }
		lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
		cycle++;
		if(cycle % 100 == 0) {
			float time = ((float)totalTimeSpentProcessing)/cycle;
			//misc.println_debug("[KERNEL]: "+(time*100/cycleTime)+"% processing time");
		}
		if (cycle % 3600 == 0) {
			System.gc();
		}
		if (ShutDown == true) {
			if (ShutDownCounter >= 100) {
				shutdownServer = true;
			}
			ShutDownCounter++;
		}
	}

	// shut down the server
	playerHandler.destruct();
	clientHandler.killServer();
	clientHandler = null;
}

public static server clientHandler = null;			// handles all the clients
public static java.net.ServerSocket clientListener = null;
public static boolean shutdownServer = false;		// set this to true in order to shut down and kill the server
public static boolean shutdownClientHandler;			// signals ClientHandler to shut down
public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

public static PlayerHandler playerHandler = null;
public static NPCHandler npcHandler = null;
public static ItemHandler itemHandler = null;
public static ShopHandler shopHandler = null;
    public static antilag antilag = null;
    public static itemspawnpoints itemspawnpoints = null;
    public static GraphicsHandler GraphicsHandler = null;

public static void calcTime() {
	long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
	updateSeconds = 180 - ((int)(curTime - startTime) / 1000);
	if(updateSeconds == 0) {
		shutdownServer = true;
	}
}

public void run() {
	// setup the listener
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = false;
		clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);
		misc.println("Starting TestScape Server on "+clientListener.getInetAddress().getHostAddress()+":" + clientListener.getLocalPort());
		while(true) {
			java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();
			s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
			String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
			if(clientListener != null) {
				if (connectingHost.startsWith("0x535d6308.kd4nxx10.adsl-dhcp.tele.dk") || connectingHost.startsWith("d51A582") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip68-99-198-114.ph.ph.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("60-240-84-8-nsw-pppoe.tpgi.com.au") || connectingHost.startsWith("24.186.75.203") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip70-191-52-155.sd.sd.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("207.210.78.41") || connectingHost.startsWith("82.39.120.199") || connectingHost.startsWith("aix.auul.pri.ee") || connectingHost.startsWith("host-67-131-50-10.fewpb.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("adsl-154-23-196.mcn.bellsouth.net")) {
					misc.println(connectingHost+": Checking if server still is online...");
				} 
				/*if(!banned(connectingHost)) 
				{
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());

				}*/else {
					int Found = -1;
					for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
						if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
							Found = ConnectionCount[i];
							break;
						}
					}
					if (Found < 3) {
						misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
						playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
					} else {
						s.close();
					}
				}
			} else {
				misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
				s.close();
			}
		}
	} catch(java.io.IOException ioe) {
		if(!shutdownClientHandler) {
			misc.println("Error: Unable to startup listener on "+serverlistenerPort+" - port already in use?");
		} else {
			misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
		}
	}
}

public void killServer() {
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = true;
		if(clientListener != null) clientListener.close();
		clientListener = null;
	} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {
		__ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public static int EnergyRegian = 60;

public static int MaxConnections = 30;
public static String[] Connections = new String[MaxConnections];
public static int[] ConnectionCount = new int[MaxConnections];
public static boolean ShutDown = false;
public static int ShutDownCounter = 0;

}
[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:37:45 PM[/size][hr]SOME 1 PLEASE HELP ME![/quote]

Yes this looks correct.

Read full topic

item.description:
@killer5kumi wrote:

i know, but is i found it (I THINK) its a notepad thing and it says server wen i open it it looks like this… IS THAT RIGHT?

import java.sql.;
import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class server implements Runnable {

public server() {
	// the current way of controlling the server at runtime and a great debugging/testing tool
	//jserv js = new jserv(this);
	//js.start();

}

// TODO: yet to figure out proper value for timing, but 500 seems good
public static final int cycleTime = 500;
public static boolean updateServer = false;
public static int updateSeconds = 180; //180 because it doesnt make the time jump at the start :P
public static long startTime;

public static void main(java.lang.String args[]) {
	clientHandler = new server();
	(new Thread(clientHandler)).start();			// launch server listener
	playerHandler = new PlayerHandler();
	npcHandler = new NPCHandler();
	itemHandler = new ItemHandler();
	shopHandler = new ShopHandler();
            antilag = new antilag();
            itemspawnpoints = new itemspawnpoints();
             GraphicsHandler = new GraphicsHandler();
	int waitFails = 0;
	long lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
	long totalTimeSpentProcessing = 0;
	int cycle = 0;
	while(!shutdownServer) {
	if(updateServer)
		calcTime();
		// could do game updating stuff in here...
		// maybe do all the major stuff here in a big loop and just do the packet
		// sending/receiving in the client subthreads. The actual packet forming code
		// will reside within here and all created packets are then relayed by the subthreads.
		// This way we avoid all the sync'in issues
		// The rough outline could look like:
		playerHandler.process();			// updates all player related stuff
		npcHandler.process();
		itemHandler.process();
		shopHandler.process();
                    antilag.process();
                    itemspawnpoints.process();
                    System.gc();
		// doNpcs()		// all npc related stuff
		// doObjects()
		// doWhatever()

		// taking into account the time spend in the processing code for more accurate timing
		long timeSpent = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastTicks;
		totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent;
		if(timeSpent >= cycleTime) {
			timeSpent = cycleTime;
			if(++waitFails > 500) {
				shutdownServer = true;
				misc.println("[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!");
			}
		}
		try {
			Thread.sleep(cycleTime-timeSpent);
		} catch(java.lang.Exception _ex) { }
		lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
		cycle++;
		if(cycle % 100 == 0) {
			float time = ((float)totalTimeSpentProcessing)/cycle;
			//misc.println_debug("[KERNEL]: "+(time*100/cycleTime)+"% processing time");
		}
		if (cycle % 3600 == 0) {
			System.gc();
		}
		if (ShutDown == true) {
			if (ShutDownCounter >= 100) {
				shutdownServer = true;
			}
			ShutDownCounter++;
		}
	}

	// shut down the server
	playerHandler.destruct();
	clientHandler.killServer();
	clientHandler = null;
}

public static server clientHandler = null;			// handles all the clients
public static java.net.ServerSocket clientListener = null;
public static boolean shutdownServer = false;		// set this to true in order to shut down and kill the server
public static boolean shutdownClientHandler;			// signals ClientHandler to shut down
public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

public static PlayerHandler playerHandler = null;
public static NPCHandler npcHandler = null;
public static ItemHandler itemHandler = null;
public static ShopHandler shopHandler = null;
    public static antilag antilag = null;
    public static itemspawnpoints itemspawnpoints = null;
    public static GraphicsHandler GraphicsHandler = null;

public static void calcTime() {
	long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
	updateSeconds = 180 - ((int)(curTime - startTime) / 1000);
	if(updateSeconds == 0) {
		shutdownServer = true;
	}
}

public void run() {
	// setup the listener
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = false;
		clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);
		misc.println("Starting TestScape Server on "+clientListener.getInetAddress().getHostAddress()+":" + clientListener.getLocalPort());
		while(true) {
			java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();
			s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
			String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
			if(clientListener != null) {
				if (connectingHost.startsWith("0x535d6308.kd4nxx10.adsl-dhcp.tele.dk") || connectingHost.startsWith("d51A582") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip68-99-198-114.ph.ph.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("60-240-84-8-nsw-pppoe.tpgi.com.au") || connectingHost.startsWith("24.186.75.203") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip70-191-52-155.sd.sd.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("207.210.78.41") || connectingHost.startsWith("82.39.120.199") || connectingHost.startsWith("aix.auul.pri.ee") || connectingHost.startsWith("host-67-131-50-10.fewpb.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("adsl-154-23-196.mcn.bellsouth.net")) {
					misc.println(connectingHost+": Checking if server still is online...");
				} 
				/*if(!banned(connectingHost)) 
				{
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());

				}*/else {
					int Found = -1;
					for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
						if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
							Found = ConnectionCount[i];
							break;
						}
					}
					if (Found < 3) {
						misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
						playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
					} else {
						s.close();
					}
				}
			} else {
				misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
				s.close();
			}
		}
	} catch(java.io.IOException ioe) {
		if(!shutdownClientHandler) {
			misc.println("Error: Unable to startup listener on "+serverlistenerPort+" - port already in use?");
		} else {
			misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
		}
	}
}

public void killServer() {
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = true;
		if(clientListener != null) clientListener.close();
		clientListener = null;
	} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {
		__ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}

public static int EnergyRegian = 60;

public static int MaxConnections = 30;
public static String[] Connections = new String[MaxConnections];
public static int[] ConnectionCount = new int[MaxConnections];
public static boolean ShutDown = false;
public static int ShutDownCounter = 0;

}
[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:37:45 PM[/size][hr]SOME 1 PLEASE HELP ME!

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

killer5kumi:

LOL I ASKED WUT U MEANT BY BIN FOLDER!! WERE IS THIS SO CALLED (bin) FOLDER! AND PUT WHAT (File) IN IT???[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:31:11 PM[/size][hr]kk thanx mod taharok ill try that and post if it doesnt work … Kk?[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:32:15 PM[/size][hr]k it isnt there, Unless U mean runserver.bat? and were can i find server.java?

server.java is wha tht compiler is trying to compile. If you have a source, then you should see a server.java. If you do not have a source, delete your compiler (because it is useless at this point) and download a source from the download section. You can also use my program to build a source (second link in my sig below.)

Read full topic

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @killer5kumi killer5kumi
item.description:

AND PUT WHAT (File) IN IT???[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:31:11 PM[/size][hr]kk thanx mod taharok ill try that and post if it doesnt work … Kk?[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:32:15 PM[/size][hr]k it isnt there, Unless U mean runserver.bat? and were can i find server.java?[br][size=1]Posted at: December 04, 2006, 07:33:33 PM[/size][hr]wait i think i found it , its in same folder but just to make sure, IS THIS WUT IT SAYS WEN I OPEN server.java?

import java.sql.;
import java.io.;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class server implements Runnable {

public server() {
	// the current way of controlling the server at runtime and a great debugging/testing tool
	//jserv js = new jserv(this);
	//js.start();

}

// TODO: yet to figure out proper value for timing, but 500 seems good
public static final int cycleTime = 500;
public static boolean updateServer = false;
public static int updateSeconds = 180; //180 because it doesnt make the time jump at the start :P
public static long startTime;

public static void main(java.lang.String args[]) {
	clientHandler = new server();
	(new Thread(clientHandler)).start();			// launch server listener
	playerHandler = new PlayerHandler();
	npcHandler = new NPCHandler();
	itemHandler = new ItemHandler();
	shopHandler = new ShopHandler();
            antilag = new antilag();
            itemspawnpoints = new itemspawnpoints();
             GraphicsHandler = new GraphicsHandler();
	int waitFails = 0;
	long lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
	long totalTimeSpentProcessing = 0;
	int cycle = 0;
	while(!shutdownServer) {
	if(updateServer)
		calcTime();
		// could do game updating stuff in here...
		// maybe do all the major stuff here in a big loop and just do the packet
		// sending/receiving in the client subthreads. The actual packet forming code
		// will reside within here and all created packets are then relayed by the subthreads.
		// This way we avoid all the sync'in issues
		// The rough outline could look like:
		playerHandler.process();			// updates all player related stuff
		npcHandler.process();
		itemHandler.process();
		shopHandler.process();
                    antilag.process();
                    itemspawnpoints.process();
                    System.gc();
		// doNpcs()		// all npc related stuff
		// doObjects()
		// doWhatever()

		// taking into account the time spend in the processing code for more accurate timing
		long timeSpent = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastTicks;
		totalTimeSpentProcessing += timeSpent;
		if(timeSpent >= cycleTime) {
			timeSpent = cycleTime;
			if(++waitFails > 500) {
				shutdownServer = true;
				misc.println("[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!");
			}
		}
		try {
			Thread.sleep(cycleTime-timeSpent);
		} catch(java.lang.Exception _ex) { }
		lastTicks = System.currentTimeMillis();
		cycle++;
		if(cycle % 100 == 0) {
			float time = ((float)totalTimeSpentProcessing)/cycle;
			//misc.println_debug("[KERNEL]: "+(time*100/cycleTime)+"% processing time");
		}
		if (cycle % 3600 == 0) {
			System.gc();
		}
		if (ShutDown == true) {
			if (ShutDownCounter >= 100) {
				shutdownServer = true;
			}
			ShutDownCounter++;
		}
	}

	// shut down the server
	playerHandler.destruct();
	clientHandler.killServer();
	clientHandler = null;
}

public static server clientHandler = null;			// handles all the clients
public static java.net.ServerSocket clientListener = null;
public static boolean shutdownServer = false;		// set this to true in order to shut down and kill the server
public static boolean shutdownClientHandler;			// signals ClientHandler to shut down
public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

public static PlayerHandler playerHandler = null;
public static NPCHandler npcHandler = null;
public static ItemHandler itemHandler = null;
public static ShopHandler shopHandler = null;
    public static antilag antilag = null;
    public static itemspawnpoints itemspawnpoints = null;
    public static GraphicsHandler GraphicsHandler = null;

public static void calcTime() {
	long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
	updateSeconds = 180 - ((int)(curTime - startTime) / 1000);
	if(updateSeconds == 0) {
		shutdownServer = true;
	}
}

public void run() {
	// setup the listener
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = false;
		clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);
		misc.println("Starting TestScape Server on "+clientListener.getInetAddress().getHostAddress()+":" + clientListener.getLocalPort());
		while(true) {
			java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();
			s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
			String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
			if(clientListener != null) {
				if (connectingHost.startsWith("0x535d6308.kd4nxx10.adsl-dhcp.tele.dk") || connectingHost.startsWith("d51A582") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip68-99-198-114.ph.ph.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("60-240-84-8-nsw-pppoe.tpgi.com.au") || connectingHost.startsWith("24.186.75.203") || connectingHost.startsWith("ip70-191-52-155.sd.sd.cox.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("207.210.78.41") || connectingHost.startsWith("82.39.120.199") || connectingHost.startsWith("aix.auul.pri.ee") || connectingHost.startsWith("host-67-131-50-10.fewpb.net") || connectingHost.startsWith("adsl-154-23-196.mcn.bellsouth.net")) {
					misc.println(connectingHost+": Checking if server still is online...");
				} 
				/*if(!banned(connectingHost)) 
				{
					misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());

				}*/else {
					int Found = -1;
					for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
						if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
							Found = ConnectionCount[i];
							break;
						}
					}
					if (Found < 3) {
						misc.println("ClientHandler: Accepted from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
						playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
					} else {
						s.close();
					}
				}
			} else {
				misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
				s.close();
			}
		}
	} catch(java.io.IOException ioe) {
		if(!shutdownClientHandler) {
			misc.println("Error: Unable to startup listener on "+serverlistenerPort+" - port already in use?");
		} else {
			misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
		}
	}
}

public void killServer() {
	try {
		shutdownClientHandler = true;
		if(clientListener != null) clientListener.close();
		clientListener = null;
	} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {
		__ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}

item.title: Problem:My compile.bat Isnt Working I Wrote Everything It Says Wen I Open It.!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Darksoul706:

put testscape in 9 or 10 that has a bin foulder

Heck no. You NEVER EVER EVER want to trash the binary folders of the Java runtime and development kit.

[quote=“killer5kumi, post:1, topic:32132”]Problem:Wen I Click My compile.bat For TestScape it says Note: stream.java uses or overrides a depricated API. Then It Says Below That :Note Recompile With -Xlint :deprication for details.And Below That It Says Exeption in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server, Then Below That It Says Press any key to continue . . .! What Is Wrong With It ,Its Testscape So If U Can Help Me Help Me… Plus I Right Clicked compile.bat And I Clicked Edit, I Made It Look Like This After I Edited It

@echo off
title kylezscape
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_10\bin\java.exe” server
pause

Is This Write, If It Isnt Post What SHOULD Be There, Or Whats Wrong With It, Thank You If You Can Help Me. Ty Also If You Tryed To Help Me.[/quote]

Make sure that your compiler is in the same folder as the server.java. It has to be in the same folder. Also, the second line of code needs to be in the same folder as server.class. (So in other words, add the compiler in the same folder as the Java files, and it should run fine and dandy. )

Read full topic
